alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 31 at 12:23AM CDT until March 31 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Shelby. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1223 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hoover, Alabaster, Pelham, Helena, Leeds, Moody, Calera, Chelsea, Montevallo, Indian Springs Village, Wilton, Oak Mountain Amphitheater, Oak Mountain State Park, Riverchase, Shelby County Airport, Inverness, Maylene, Meadowbrook, Highland Lakes and American Village.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
